article.headline: UMKC 80, Oakland, Mich. 76, OT
article.story: KANSAS CITY, Mo. (AP) -- Brian Gettinger scored 12 of his career-high 18 points in overtime Thursday to lead Missouri-Kansas City to an 80-76 win over Oakland at Kemper Arena. The win broke a three-game losing streak for the Kangaroos (9-18, 4-7). At times the Golden Grizzlies (15-12, 8-3) dominated the game, leading by 14 at 40-26 with 16:35 left in the game after leading 31-23 at halftime. But the Kangaroos came back behind leading scorer Dee Ayuba, who had 21 of his game-high 25 points in the second half. He had six points in the final 1:33 of regulation, including a rebound basket with 9 seconds left to tie the game at 64-64. In overtime, Oakland built a four-point lead after a 3-pointer by Erik Kangas made it 70-66 with 2:37 to play. Gettinger responded with a long 3-pointer from the right wing, then had a three-point play that gave UMKC a 72-70 lead with 1:25 to play. The Golden Grizzlies had five players in double figures, led by Hopes with 18. Kangas added 17, Johnathon Jones with 15, Vova Severovas had 13 and Derick Nelson finished with 10.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
